intro: Agelaea nitida, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving them a velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Agelaea nitida is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, shady environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
